etymologies: early 18th century (as a modern Latin term in botany: see style): erroneous spelling of Latin stilus

definitions: a hard point, typically of diamond or sapphire, following a groove in a record and transmitting the recorded sound for reproduction.
shortDefinitions: hard point following groove in record

definitions: a pointed device formerly used to produce a groove in a record when recording sound.
shortDefinitions: pointed device producing groove in record when recording sound

definitions: an ancient writing implement, consisting of a small rod with a pointed end for scratching letters on wax-covered tablets, and a blunt end for obliterating them.
shortDefinitions: ancient writing implement, consisting of small rod with pointed end for scratching letters on wax-covered tablets

definitions: an implement with a pointed end used especially for engraving and tracing.
shortDefinitions: small implement with pointed end used for engraving and tracing

definitions: a device resmbling a pen, used to input handwritten text or drawings directly into a computer or for input on a touch-sensitive monitor.
shortDefinitions: pen-like device used to input handwritten text
